unittitle_ssm: Grand Army of the Republic, Department of New York, Harry Lee Post No. 21 records
abstract_ssm: The Grand Army of the Republic (GAR), a national fraternity of Union Army Civil War veterans, came to prominence in the late 19th century.  This collection, spanning the period circa 1870 to 1935, contains records of the Brooklyn-based Harry Lee Post No. 21, a unit of the New York Department of the GAR.  The records are comprised of member lists, meeting minutes, one photograph, and four bound volumes detailing the activities of the Post and the military backgrounds and personal histories of hundreds of Post members, with particular emphasis on their dates of death and burial locations.
